page.title: 12TRANSPORT ON SCORAIG
page.content: PEOPLE ON SCORAIG GO TO INVERNESS FOR MOST OF THEIR SHOPPING.MOST HAVE A CAR OR VAN BUT SOME SHARE A VEHICLE. IT IS NECESSARY TO CROSS LITTLE LOCH BROOM BY BOAT IN ORDER TO DRIVE ANYWHERE.MANY PEOPLE HAVE A SHARE IN THE "MOORING BOAT".THE BOATS ARE POWER ED BY OUTBOARD ENGINES SUCH AS YAMAHAS OR SEAGULLS.WHEN SOMETHING REALLY LARGE LIKE A TRACTOR HAS TO CROSS THE LOCH TWO BOATS ARE JOINED TOGETHER BY A PLATFORM AND OPERATED CATAMARAN-LIKE WITH AN OUTBOARD ON EACH BOAT. PEOPLE GET AROUND MOSTLY BY WALKING. SOME GO BY PUSH-BIKE OR MOTORBIKE. TRACTORS WITH TRAILERS,BUCKRAKES OR TRANSPORT BOX ARE ESSENTIAL FOR MOVING HEAVY THINGS FROM THE SHORE OR FROM CROFT TO CROFT.THERE IS ALSO A DUMPER TRUCK AND WHEELBARROW FOR THOSE WHO HAVE NEITHER.
